meanings.definition: Vulgarizers: a person who makes something vulgar or common
meanings.sent1: The vulgarizers in the movie industry often add unnecessary crude jokes to films.
meanings.sent2: The vulgarizers of society tend to lower the standards of decency.
meanings.sent3: The party was full of vulgarizers who couldn't appreciate the elegance of the event.
meanings.sent4: Her friends were like vulgarizers, turning every conversation into something tasteless.
meanings.sent5: The vulgarizers in the group always managed to find a way to ruin the atmosphere with their crass humor.

meanings.definition: Vulgarizers: to make something vulgar or common
meanings.sent1: Some comedians vulgarize their jokes to appeal to a broader audience.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to vulgarize art in an attempt to make it more popular.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally vulgarized the traditional recipe by adding too many spices.
meanings.sent4: The tabloids often vulgarize celebrities' personal lives for sensationalism.
meanings.sent5: The author refused to vulgarize her writing style to cater to mainstream readers.
